author: xtqqczze
body:
cc: @iSazonov 

I'm seeing many CodeFactor "complex method" false positives issues in CI, perhaps we should disable this issue category.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I wouldn't want to hide the fact that there really are a lot of methods that should have been simplified.
Such methods are difficult to read and understand, and what is especially unpleasant is that they are a source of bugs.
 CodeFactor is an auxiliary tool for us, so I wouldn't worry about false-positives.

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body:
I think the false positives lead to a bad experience for new contributors. Realistically these complex methods issues will likely never be fixed so I'm not sure what value there is anyway in these showing up in the PR checks,

The false positives make it hard to tell if a failed check is "real" from Github PR summary:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45661989/124503010-8c28b400-ddbc-11eb-9583-8018762b3b53.png)

Also Github desktop:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45661989/124503247-0ce7b000-ddbd-11eb-9ccb-1d6c92a9d2b9.png)

comments.body:
